Text:
(It has been a month since we opened Mitsugoshi and
started running the new shop.)

(Things have settled down around the Shadow
Garden, but...)

(Working as a writer while looking into the the Cult of
Diablos and Templars...)
I have so much to do!
(My writing career is going well.)

(It's helpful that the bookshop inside Mitsugoshi has
its own special MNA collaboration area where people
can always get Natsume Kafka books.)
(Well, the MNA Midgar capital branch has one, too.)

(The easy access for people to drop by while shopping
has really driven sales.)

(Performers like Epsilon can't do business
like this.)

I'm still playing catch-up, but I'm not going to
lose! Yeah!

(Even if it's sparse, I'm still getting little bits
of intel on the Cult of Diablos.)

(They're so hard to track. Even if I find a trail to
follow, it usually ends up leading to some small
branch group and ending there.)

(But still, dig deep enough and there's always
something. You really get a sense for just how
much influence the Cult has behind the scenes.)

(But I get the feeling that central control doesn't
always reach the outlying branches.)

(And if that's the case, skillfully manipulating those
gaps might help reveal the structure of Cult sects
within the capital.)

(There is the main Fenrir sect, the Loki sect, the
Hela sect, and the Jormungand sect.)

(I don't know how each sect breaks down or the roles
they play, but I will find out.)
Hmmmm...
(I still don't know anything about the Templars.)

(Intel and records are simply too sparse, so we've
just been wasting resources looking.)

(Gamma and Epsilon say we should be focusing our
investigation on the the Cult of Diablos...)

In truth, we're at a total loss. We haven't got
any new leads at all.
Hey there. Sorting out materials again today?
Yes. I've been in the capital all month.
It must be hard living a double life.

It's not just me, though. Gamma and Epsilon do it too.
Once you get used to it, it's actually kind of fun.
Huh. I think I'd get tired of it in about a week.
Hahaha.

Oh, Zeta, I was wondering. Do you have anything new
about the Templars?
Hmm. Not a thing.
That's too bad.

So are you more worried about the Templars
than the Cult?

Not sure I'd say worried, but thinking of the warriors
we've faced so far, haven't the Templars been better
trained than the Cultists?

I think we've only been facing sacrificial outer
layers that keep us from getting near the truly
powerful organization at the core of the Cult.

I guess what you're saying is, if we've got another
powerful opponent besides the Cult, then it's best
to eliminate them as a source of anxiety?
I guess so.

Info from the MNA helped you find the Lindwurm
hideout, didn't it?

And then when you came with me and Epsilon to the
hideout, the Shadow Garden had its first run-in with
the Templars...
Yes, that's true, but

Wait, are you saying that you think the MNA has
intel on the Templars as well as the Cult?
It's a possibility.
Have you already decided to check it out?

Not really. I figured if someone else did it, that'd
save me a lot of trouble. Hint, hint.

Is that what this is? Are you trying to get me
interested?

Well, you know, if you were in the mood to do it on
your own, it would be good for both of us.
A "win-win," as Shadow would say.

I can't help but feel you've played me like a fiddle,
but I also can't say you're wrong.
I guess I'll go poke around the MNA!
